channel.title: Python on Hard drive
channel.description: Recent content in Python on Hard drive

item.title: Js differences
item.description: True and False are uppercase. and, or, is and not are keywords to compare and negate. None is an object. Always compare with is instead of ==. Using boolean logical operators on ints casts them to booleans for evaluation, but their non-cast value is returned. Don’t mix up with bool(ints) and & or |. bool(4) # => True bool(-6) # => True 0 and 2 # => 0 -5 or 0 # => -5 You can chain < and so.
